title: As a musician, have you ever had your work stolen, and what did you do about it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes - 3 times1) I heard my song (chorus) being sung by a well known band over a dept store’s speakers. Freaked me out. I proceeded to take action. The attorney’s for their label basically told me they would squash me like a bug and since I was a 19 year old kid at the time with an up and coming band, I couldn’t afford to get black-listed. 2) some rapper took one of my instrumentals and rapped over it. Sued him, he settled. He still has to pay me every time it’s sold and it can’t be “shelved” (taken off the market) for 2 more years. 3) was in a movie theater and heard my score in a trailer. Called my publisher and within 48 hours the trailer was pulled from every theater — none of the other composers for the trailer were cleared either (in case you didn’t know, the trailer music is usually not the music from the movie)

Yeah, if you google “Grxymkjbn Music” (that’s me), you’ll see hundreds of sites that are pirating my music… many of them not even in English. I don’t care. First, I don’t suppose for a moment that any one of them has ever made more than 50c from my material (because I’m a nobody and no one knows me or my work)… and, if they’re driven to steal others’ artistic efforts to try to make some $… wow. That’s pretty pathetic. bro. Hope you can make enough to keep your pet cat alive. Have at it, more power to ya. And secondly, that’s all I ever wanted from music: Is for someone to want to listen to the music I make as badly as I wanted to make it. It’s like baking a cake or crafting a sandwich: If you make it, and no one wants it…… then, why bother?
